page.title: 12Quantock Animals
page.content: If you are lucky you may see {Red Deer feeding in the early morning or late evening .During the day they rest in the bracken. Near Triscombe you may find the {White Hind}.In Autumn at rutting time the {Stag} begins to roar. Many of the {Hill Ponies} were taken off this year but there are still two small groups living wild . { {Foxes}are around and can be seen in day light near picnic places. The cubs are very active in May and June. { {Rabbits} are numerous again and the occasional {Brown Hare} lollops over the lower slopes.{Grey Squirrels} are in all the wooded combes constantly dashing from tree to tree. Dusk is the time most likely for sighting {Badgers but{usually}you only see {evidence}of activity out side his sett.
